intro: Tarenna friesiorum, commonly known as the Madagascar star anise, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped fruits that resemble those of the star anise, although it is not related to the true star anise. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Tarenna friesiorum is valued for its ornamental qualities and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
